children.subject: it'll depend on whether or not there are seats left over, see @1192
Is there any reason that it is unlikely for non-seniors to get into EE16a? If I am undeclared CS but sign up for it in Phase I, will I be able to get in?

Do you know around when in June the purge will happen? I have an Incomplete for one of my pre-reqs, and I'm not sure generally how long it'll take for that to be replaced after final grades show up, so I'm wondering if the purge would happen before my grade are fixed...

Thanks!
please see @2309. In short no, because purging may happen before apps are processed since phase 2 happens before the semester is over.
Will the same logic apply for spring 2017 enrollment? I understand major application processing might occur at a different time so this might not be a thing for fall declarations?

history.content:
Firstly, please review our enrollment policies: http://www.eecs.berkeley.edu/Policies/enrollment.shtml 

Students that are applying for the major this semester need to fill out this online application before the last day of lecture. We'll process the applications after we are able to see grades (which is usually later than when you have access to grades.) We expect to notify students via email mid-June. 

For your enrollment appointment happening in the next 2 weeks, please plan on signing up for a non-cs tech electives, or other requirements. Phase 1 ends on July 15, so when you get declared, you may be able to go back into Cal Central to change your schedule. 

Historically, it had been likely for newly declared/undeclared students to get into CS 188 and 170, but we are no longer able to confidently recommend those courses for fall 16. It is also unlikely that non-seniors would get into EE 16A.

As such, please plan accordingly for a viable back-up plan. I'm sorry we don't have better news, please let us know if you have questions. 

tl;dr: only declared CS/EECS students can enroll/waitlist during phase 1, all other students have to wait until phase 2 (or mid-June for newly declaring students). For phase 1, please plan on non-cs tech electives or other requirements. Please read about enrollment policies here.

UPDATE: We just found out that we have limited capabilities in Cal Central for limiting who can get onto the waitlist, so anyone and everyone can waitlist for upper div CS courses. HOWEVER, WAITLISTS WILL BE PURGED after we process major apps in June. So what does this mean? 


For students declaring this semester, our advice remains the same as above because we can't guarantee that there will be spots in the course. You may have a slight advantage on getting on the waitlist earlier, but until we purge the waitlist of non-EECS/non-CS Majors, waitlist lengths/positions won't really be accurate indicators of your chances of getting into the course.


For all other students who are not-declared, not-CS/EECS, pls wait until phase 2 to sign up for CS upper divs as to not waste your phase 1 units. (You might be able to get on the waitlist now, but if you're not declared when we purge waitlists in June, you'll be removed from the waitlist.)
